info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and southern Powell Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 515 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Philipsburg, or 16 miles southwest of Drummond, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philipsburg, Maxville, Hall, Princeton and New Chicago. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
